javelin.model.world.place.town

Class Town

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.WorldActor
      • javelin.model.world.place.WorldPlace
        • javelin.model.world.place.town.Town
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Town
extends WorldPlace
    A hub for upgrading units, resting, participating in tournament, renting transportation, buying items... Each town has it's own profile which is predetermined.
    Author:
    alex
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • events

        public java.util.ArrayList<Exhibition> events

      • size

        public int size
        Represent 10 working citizens that will produce 1 labor every 10 days. An arbitrary decision is to try to fit the game-span of a normal game into a 1-year period, which puts a town max size roughly at 10 if it does nothing but grow TODO link

      • labor

        public float labor
        Can be used to improve a town. 1 unit represents 10 days of work by a 10-men crew.

      • automanage

        public boolean automanage

      • research

        public ResearchData research
        Contains Research data structures.

        Next task for the automanager.

      • lodging

        Higher levels allow better rest.

      • transport

        public Transport transport
        Higher levels allow better travel methods.

      • getel

        protected java.lang.Integer getel(int attackerel)
        Description copied from class: WorldPlace
        Only called for WorldPlace.sacrificeable places when being reached by an Incursion.
        Specified by:
        getel in class WorldPlace
        Parameters:
        attackerel - Given an attacking encounter level...
        Returns:
        the defending encounter level. A null value is allowed because some places should not be conquered.
        See Also:
        WorldActor.impermeable, Incursion.fight(int, int)
